sect1.title: Introduction
sect1.para:
tape archive record tar
GNOME Archive Generator makes compressed tape archive record (tar) files. A tar file is a single bundled file containing a directory or group of files, sometimes called a tarball.

To start GNOME Archive Generator, open the Main Menu, then choose
Programs Utilities Archive Generator . To run GNOME Archive Generator from a command line type meat-grinder, then press Return.
The gnome-utils package, part of the GNOME desktop environment, includes GNOME Archive Generator. This document describes version &version; of GNOME Archive Generator.

sect1.title: Basic usage
sect1.para:
GNOME Archive Generator opens with an empty Main window, as shown in .
GNOME Archive Generator Main Window.
GNOME Archive Generator Main Window

To archive files or directories, drag their icons from your file manager to the GNOME Archive Generator main window. A folder icon represents a directory.
GNOME Archive Generator Main Window
GNOME Archive Generator Main Window
GNOME Archive Generator Main Window
GNOME Archive Generator works on copies of your files and directories. The originals remain in their original location.

step.para: Choose File Create archive . A standard file selection dialog opens.
Choose the location to save the new archive file.
Enter a name for the archive file.

note.para: GNOME Archive Generator places no restrictions on the file name you enter. Most applications expect names of compressed archive files to end in .tar.gz or .tgz.

sect2.title: Menus
sect2.para: The menubar, located at the top of the Main Window, contains the following menus:

listitem.para:
Remove
— Remove any highlighted file or directory from the main window. The original file is not removed. GNOME Archive Generator works on a copy.

Clear
— Clear all files or directories from the main window. The original files or directories are left untouched.

Select All
— Select all files and directories in the main window.
About — Open the About dialog to show basic information about GNOME Archive Generator.

sect1.para: GNOME Archive Generator was written by George Lebl (jirka@5z.com). This manual was written by John Fleck (jfleck@inkstain.net).
